website_summaries.verdict: The Vibram FiveFingers V-Train was deemed very comfortable and felt light on the foot when used for extended periods. It delighted many barefoot training enthusiasts with the freedom of movement.
pros: Many buyers were happy with the lightweight nature of the Vibram FiveFingers V-Train
Several consumers reported that the trainer helped them ease the shin splint pain
A significant number of reviewers enjoyed the comfortable barefoot-like feel provided by the trainer
The grip of the outsole was efficient for most users
A few Vibram fans observed that this model offered more lateral support than other versions
Some people appreciated that the upper material kept the interior of the shoe well ventilated
cons: Some wearers thought that the use of both the strap and the laces was redundant
The hook-and-loop strap consistently came loose, according to a handful of users

customer_reviews.title: Over engineered, stiff and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had a pair of FiveFingers ever since they released their first pair and obviously love them. I live in them! This is the first pair I’ve not liked! Awkward to put on, stiff and conformable to wear for longer than a workout. I’ve always bought the top end fitness ones they make but these are so over engineered. It’s trying too much to feel like a trainer. If I wanted to wear a trainer I’d wear a trainer! DO NOT BUY! Go for the KSO Evo instead.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Fox

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, quality shoe, designed for runners and running.
customer_reviews.text: Was concerned about the size, so got a size larger than normal. What a mistake, ended up sliding inside the shoe. Very annoying. The shoes itself, is good quality, the error was on my side, and will have to buy thick socks to fill the void spaces. Not sure if they will stand the test of time and punishment. Most of my running shoes are destroyed within 2 to 3 month's, so we shall see. However, I can feel how beneficial these shoes can be, they have a nice balance to them.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin. G

customer_reviews.title: Love this shoe - find right size
customer_reviews.text: Like all reviews, takes a few attempts to get used to wearing, however, WELL WORTH the effort. I absolutely love this for all my training including weights, bodyweight and yoga/style training. Haven’t run in them yet as not used to barefoot shoes and need to build up. I feel connected and stable and they’re soft and comfortable too. It took me three goes to get correct size. Gradually decreasing each time. Glad I persisted though. Fitting wise I’m normal width 11 and got to 10-10.5 for best fit. Should be snug. I use thin injinji or vibram toe socks too.
customer_reviews.author: Woodlington

customer_reviews.title: Long toes! But great value.
customer_reviews.text: Took three returns to get the right fit! These are great shoes but as one other reviewer said "toes are very long" or my toes are short! I usually wear 13 but found the 13-14 size far too big. There was a cm gap at the end of my toes! Same for 12-13 and even size eleven - which I am wearing now - is not really a snug fit. That said, I was able to return the first two pairs and order new ones with minimal fuss!
customer_reviews.author: kittymcvitie

customer_reviews.title: First cracks and holes showed up after 600km
customer_reviews.text: If you are uninitiated - that number is amazing - I had so many shoes that I had to throw away after 300-400km. It's 750km on the counter at the moment and It's time to replace those (probably for exactly the same model if possible :))
customer_reviews.author: DMK

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!!
customer_reviews.text: Game changer! For the gym, doing squats, dead lifts, these are the best. Running on the treadmill was different but better. I tore my calf a few years ago and the bare foot feel has made me realise I’m turning my foot out differently. Consciously correcting it has already strengthened the injured calf. Get some “toe socks”. It’ll keep the trainers fresh. Overall I can only conclude that standard trainers are mitten shaped because they’re easier to make and not better. If you’re in doubt to buy them...don’t be!!
customer_reviews.author: Philfiftythree

customer_reviews.title: Running, Powerlifting and All round footwear!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome shoes! Started walking in them to stretch the feet out (had other vibrams before). Now using as all round shoes and for running. Feet so much better, and really help with compound lifts such as squat, deadlift and overhead press. Highly recommend! We were designed to be barefoot so this is the next best thing!
customer_reviews.author: brandon

customer_reviews.title: Good for gym work or short runs on or off ...
customer_reviews.text: I take a UK size 9 shoe & the V-Train size 8.5/9 fits perfectly. Good for gym work or short runs on or off road but not grippy enough for muddy tracks or paths. Can be quite difficult at first getting your toes in but became a lot easier after wearing six or so times. Bit of a pain having both Velcro strap & laces but I guess the strap holds laces in place for working out in the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Long toes
customer_reviews.text: These have longer toes than expected, so I had to drop from a UK size 12 to 11/11.5. Overall, I couldn’t see myself doing any outdoor running in this. So, back they went.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Super shoes. Take a little getting used to
customer_reviews.text: Super shoes. Take a little getting used to, wearing gloves on your feet feels a little weird at first, especially if your toes are compressed by shoes. Go for half a size smaller than you would normally wear. I'm normally a 9, but got the 8.5-9 size, which fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Huw Burford-Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Vibrams
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Bought my usual size, a 44 and they fit perfect. Worn them for about a week and they're very comfy and offer better protection than my ELX's but still give that barefoot feel. Can't recommend them enough. My Vibram ELX's were my favourites, now these are.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, sizes too large
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, very sturdy, very comfortable but size very long on the toes. Had I known I would have got a size smaller. Try in store before buying.
customer_reviews.author: IanD

customer_reviews.title: Five Finger shoes
customer_reviews.text: My 13th pair of Five Finger shoes. As good as any other pair I’ve worn. I wear them for everyday activities, work and working out in the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh Brandon

customer_reviews.title: The way nature intend
customer_reviews.text: Love my 5 fingers. Have not had a chance to wear probably (a training session). Ordered 10 half 11 and possibly big, (I have broad feet) but scared to go smaller in case to small. I will only know when I'm out there.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe from vibram as always.
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfy, have many styles of vibrams alway ordered my normal size in vibrams apart from two pairs where I had to order a size down, very quick delivery really happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Big D

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic but pricey
customer_reviews.text: They’re great but not at the price so had to return them :(
customer_reviews.author: Wessley Sim

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good product, maybe best to order half a size smaller than normal shoe size.
customer_reviews.author: Del

customer_reviews.title: Used for different indoor and outdoor sports. Or just walking
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable and have helped me recover my arch. They emulate barefoot walking.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos Cherem

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable and light weight. Fits very well & feels like you're even wearing shoes!
customer_reviews.author: idiily

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable  .. Must haves
customer_reviews.text: A must have ..barefoot vibrams ,beautifully made .. I get alot of people asking and looking . head turners .. very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Mustafa .. SoG

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect for feet
customer_reviews.text: If you have a perfect foot It would fit your feet 99% of feet Are not perfect
customer_reviews.author: ALAN T.

customer_reviews.title: Great product. The science works brilliantly
customer_reviews.text: If you follow the vibram size chart they will fit perfectly. Great product. The science works brilliantly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Harsh
customer_reviews.text: Hard to get on. Harsh to run in. No cushioning whatsoever. Not for me.
customer_reviews.author: djscott66

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase, but learn to wear them slowly!
customer_reviews.text: Pleasure to wear, but take your time getting used to them. I wear them a few minutes more each day, starting at about 10 minutes. You can feel different muscles working like never before.
customer_reviews.author: Dr V R

customer_reviews.title: amazing workout V
customer_reviews.text: amazing workout V. have 7 different pairs this ones are not exactly barefoot feel as sole is thicker but perfect for squats / deadlifts.
customer_reviews.author: Goomy

customer_reviews.title: Initially takes a while to get used to
customer_reviews.text: Takes a little getting used to but overall very good feels natural after a while
customer_reviews.author: Kaid Ishmael

customer_reviews.title: Well worth buying
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable training shoe, just takes some practice getting your toes in. I got a size bigger so I could wear socks.
customer_reviews.author: Rr

customer_reviews.title: they are so comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Why did omit buy these earlier, they are so comfortable
customer_reviews.author: blue

customer_reviews.title: Vibram five fingers
customer_reviews.text: Great comfortable footwear a natural way to run and train once you get used to them not being padded like trainers
customer_reviews.author: tim schwaiger

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: Had to go a size bigger than normal, but best running shoes I've owned
customer_reviews.author: P D KASLIK

customer_reviews.title: Fingers like toes doesn’t work but treating your toes like Fingers works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Toes fit perfectly into the Fingers which makes walking a pleasure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A size to big but can work around it for squat and deadlifts
customer_reviews.author: john howis

customer_reviews.title: Vibram
customer_reviews.text: Great product I’m really happy with my purchase. Delivery was as described and came very quick, well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Not really Minimalist but fun to run in
customer_reviews.text: are overly heavy, overly developed, more style than function, and far too hard and protective to be really considered barefoot running, they are closer to trainers than they are vibram KSO fivefingers. but they were great fun on the trail run today. The strap is not necessary, and the laces need to be taken down a notch so they are not under the strap putting pressure on the foot,
customer_reviews.author: dominic  bower

customer_reviews.title: Good fit, but sweaty as hell
customer_reviews.text: So, had these a wee while. To begin with fine, but I can't use them now, the sweating is just too annoying. I'm not a sweaty feet kinda person, but these just turn into a sticky, slippery mess of sweat in any heat. A real shame! I suppose that's what socks are for!!
customer_reviews.author: Sean Mclean

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for cooling down.
customer_reviews.text: I like them, however they take some getting use to. A bit of a riggle to put on.
customer_reviews.author: Ex Second row.

product_meta.title: Vibram FiveFingers Men's V-Train Fitness Shoes
product_meta.description: The V-Train is the perfect training and fitness shoe, for use in and out of the gym
feature_bullets: Our latest version of the kmd sport
Provides flexibility of a barefoot shoe with a little more structure
Special rope traction lugs in arch for rope climbing
Circular lug pattern for grip during lateral movement
